pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Global footprint​​

Our reach for our current campaigns include the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, France and Germany. For these countries, we plan, develop, and execute campaigns across all relevant advertising channels.

Each year, we review and refresh our scope of markets and work closely with our business partners to extend our reach and footprint to additional areas. We also maintain a rich library of assets across channels that are available worldwide.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Global assets
and toolkits

We design our campaigns with global reach in mind including how the talent is shown when speaking, the products included in the ads, and worldwide usage rights. Typically, our marketing assets can be used globally for one year after their launch. Markets can localize these assets to their audiences with voiceover and subtitles in their language and customized end cards.

They can also amplify our campaigns with local partners, retailers, and more. We work closely with our worldwide CMOs to plan and execute the extension of the campaigns globally.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: How apps can make corporate communications easier

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Without being able to communicate goals and expectations, a business can’t grow. Although corporate communication is generally associated more with large corporations, with their dizzying number of departments and sub-departments, this statement is equally applicable to smaller enterprises, where employees might need to take on multiple roles.

Skype today announced something they call Skype Groups. What this means is that a corporation can fill up the Skype balance of their employees from one spot and keep and eye on who is using how much of their time. SkypeOut, SkypeIn and Voicemail is of course a part of it. Nice.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: The importance of branding at Contoso

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: At the heart of branding at Contoso is the promise that is made by us to our customers. The brand promise tells them who we are, what we believe in, and what unique value we provide.

Branding is important to the success of any organization, but it's particularly important for us at Contoso Electronics. This news posts is an example of how you can use two different images for display. The top header image is 1920 x 1080 with a safe space of 320px in height - where the posters are aligned to. In page details, there is a second image that will display as the news thumbnail. It is also 1920x1080, a 16:9 ratio that works best in most of our thumbnail displays.

In order to give customers fresh and clear experiences with their brand, companies need to focus on simplifying their customer experiences. Those efforts will drive innovation and growth for their business.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Brand strategy is a moving target and no matter how many strategies I create for clients big or small, new or established, I always get nervous at the beginning of the process.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: 5 Elements of a Brilliant Sales Narrative

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Don’t kick off a sales presentation by talking about your product, your headquarters locations, your investors, your clients, or anything about yourself.

Instead, name the undeniable shift in the world that creates both (a) big stakes and (b) huge urgency for your prospect.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Corporate Communications Define Your Brand and Culture

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Corporate communications are carefully crafted key messages that provide the face and voice to your brand. They define your culture and company to the world.

Successful product growth and engagement is fundamentally linked to whether customers understand and realize the value it offers. While all product teams aspire to create an elegant user experience and functionality that enables customers to intuitively “get it” after they try it, product marketers are focused on conveying the product’s value to the customer to engage, convert and retain them. Product marketers play a key role in driving awareness and trial as well as packaging the product to appeal to customers. They accomplish this by packaging a product’s features and functionality into messaging and positioning, pricing, and collateral.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: What's the difference between customer support and customer engagement

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Is customer service part of the customer experience? Or is customer experience what happens when someone receives customer service? Are they the same thing?

The terms “customer service” and “customer experience” are often confused or used interchangeably. They’re not the same thing, but they are related.

The difference between customer service and customer experience is that while customer service is one piece of the puzzle — focused on human interaction and directly supporting customers — customer experience is the sum of the entire customer journey with your business.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
In September, members of the Contoso marketing team and myself took part in a 2-week visit with our partners in Singapore. The purpose of the trip was four-fold: to deeply engage with our Singapore sales leads; to conduct customer briefings; to get an inside look at our manufacturing process; and to get a tour of our new Singapore sales location set to open next year.  

Note: This report covers highlights from 10 very deep and busy days. If there is information you'd like to see that is not covered here, you want more details, or if you have questions for me or the team members who attended, let us know.

While in Singapore we were able to conduct 15 customer briefings over a span of 3 days:

  SCHEDULED ACTUAL RESPONSES
DAY 1 6 5 8
DAY 2 6 6 12
DAY 3 5 4 7
TOTAL 17 15 27

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Highlights of our visit

  • Face-to-face briefings with 15 key customers.

  • A planning and strategy meeting with Contoso Singapore sales leads Michael Zhou, Dylan Price, and Bo Xiong. We established new channels to streamline efficiency between our U.S. and Singapore partners. 

  • A meeting with manufacturing partners at Fabrikam, Inc. for a tour of their facility and an overview of their manufacturing process.  

  • A tour of the new Contoso Singapore office to which our Sales department will be moving soon.

Key outcomes and takeaways 

  • Feedback from customer briefings indicate a high level of satisfaction, but we have more work to do to continue increasing adoption rate.

  • Face-to-face meetings helped establish a meaningful rapport with sales partners in Singapore. 

  • Established new channels of communication to streamline efficiency and teamwork, including the use of Teams for work on key initiatives. 

  • Documented our manufacturing process, including images and visuals, which are presented later in this document.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Contoso Singapore building tour

Thanks to our facilities partners for a tour of the new building where our Contoso sales department will be housed. Construction is nearly finished, and I am pleased to hear that we are on track for the target opening.  

Singapore itself has emerged as a global powerhouse over the past decades, with the presence of major international companies growing every day. Singapore matches our own innovative spirit, integrity, and passion for growth. We cannot be more excited for the upcoming opening.

–

“It is an amazing space that will serve as a hub for our global community, and we are excited for the potential it brings.”

MIRIAM GRAHAM

Customer briefing feedback 

Each Contoso Electronics briefing attendee was asked to provide feedback about the meetings they participated in. We had 3 primary goals: to find out if the sales team was getting value from these meetings, if the customer was perceived to be getting value, and if we could identify customers that could potentially make good reference accounts for case studies and other customer evidence.

 

average scores below reflect only the meetings that took place rather than all scores including the few that didn’t show for their meeting.

Q: Was the customer meeting a good use of your time: 8.27 rating
Q: Do you feel the customer got value from the meeting: 8.40 rating

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: How apps can make corporate communications easier

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Without being able to communicate goals and expectations, a business can’t grow. Although corporate communication is generally associated more with large corporations, with their dizzying number of departments and sub-departments, this statement is equally applicable to smaller enterprises, where employees might need to take on multiple roles.
Contoso's Miriam Graham and Lee Gu go behind the scenes talking with internal and external experts to reveal how Contoso can work best for you.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Strategic communication: How to develop strategic massaging and positioning

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: This article covers the essentials of strategic communication. The goal is to explain why it is critical that companies understand strategic messaging and positioning. In addition, we will discuss some practical and actionable approaches to help you design strategic messaging and product positioning.
